list_definition.definition: the amount which a person or thing weighs

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s put on a lot of weight (= got much fatter) over the years.

list_definition.definition: a piece of metal etc of a standard weight
a heavy object, especially one for lifting as a sport

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He lifts weights to develop his muscles.
You have taken a weight off my mind.
Her opinion carries a lot of weight.

list_definition.definition: to attach, or add, a weight or weights to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plane is weighted at the nose so that it balances correctly in flight.

list_definition.definition: to hold down by attaching weights

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They weighted the balloon to prevent it from flying away.

list_ex_of_english: Standard deviations of importance weights under interval ranking were generally low.
Other weights may be regarded as more suitable depending on the circumstances.
Retrospective index weights used in multiple trait selection in maize breeding programme.
At each vine harvest the numbers and the fresh weights were recorded.
The published evidence for quadriceps strengthening using weights, for instance, is quite unequivocal.
The mean weights of the pairs were equally distributed over the five stables.
Changes in actual collection times come closer to a welfare impact but need to be weighted by the opportunity cost of time.
The maximum correlation of each variable with an index of these two variables was obtained with equal weights for the two variables.
